result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Groth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation to be served in MIlwaukee County.  
Probation review hearing 11/6/2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 40.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Court struck the DV assessment. Failure to pay will result in a civil  judgment.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim-parents are allowd to contact victim for purposes of retrieving storage unit items/his personal possessions.
No contact with firearms.
If probation conditions are successfully completed, Court will grant expungement.

Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention Program.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Attend the probation review hearing on 11/6/2015.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered 60 days in HOC, STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department (20 days as to each case, this case, 15CM1689 and 15CM2300).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua M Groth not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent in court. Defendant not in court, but probation review report was good. Court advised agent to schedule further review with the court if needed. No warrant or condition time imposed.

Defendant Joshua M Groth in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
If probation conditions are successfully completed, Court will grant expungement.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve  5 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 32 days served.
Court struck the DV assessment enhancer

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

As to this case, Case# 15CM001209 and 15CM001689:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS with the following conditions:
- Probation is to be served in Milwaukee County
- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department. (20 days as to each case)
- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim - parents are allowed to contact victim for purposes of retrieving storage unit items/his personal possessions
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. (Court struck the DV assessment)  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-215.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Joshua M Groth in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Joshua M Groth in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 and Count 3 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Joshua M Groth not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for bail hearing.  Counsel needs to get more information.  Defendant has other cases set in this court on 7/21/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.F. (10/21/78) OR S.Z. (6/6/78)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua M Groth in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Joshua M Groth in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS LOWER PENDING CASES AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
